title: Corrections & Amplifications
text:
Boeing Co. was incorrectly referred to as Boeing Corp. in a Page One article on Monday about companies' rethinking mask and vaccine mandates.

(See: "Masks Come Off as Companies Ease Their Pandemic Protocols" -- WSJ April 4, 2022)

---

Thirty-two Hong Kong-listed companies suspended trading in their shares on April 1 to comply with the city's listing rules. An Exchange article and headline on Saturday about the suspensions incorrectly said that the city's exchange operator, Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing Ltd., suspended the shares.

(See: "EXCHANGE --- Big Chinese Property Stocks Are Suspended" -- WSJ April 2, 2022)

---

Alphabet subsidiary Wing is delivering goods by drone in Christiansburg, Va. An Exchange article on Saturday about drone delivery incorrectly said the company is delivering in Charlottesville, Va.

(See: "EXCHANGE --- Keywords: Your Drone Delivery Is Here --- In some parts of the country, packages are starting to land from above" -- WSJ April 2, 2022)

---

Short-selling reports for March 15 were released on March 24. The Ticker table of the week's scheduled market events in Monday's Business & Finance section incorrectly said short-selling reports for March 15 were scheduled for release on Monday.

---

Readers can alert The Wall Street Journal to any errors in news articles by e-mailing wsjcontact@wsj.com or by calling 888-410-2667.
